titleStmt.title: Oxfordshire damosel, or, The London merchant's choice. Her beauty bright was his delight, but yet she said him nay, she would not yield to him the field, till marriage made the way. To the tune of, The jobb for a journey-man-shoomaker.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, at the Angel in Guilt-spur street without Newgate.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "There was as fine a London blade ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Angel in Guilt-spur street without Newgate.
